snippet: A state judge approved a settlement on Wednesday that lets Cooper Union for the Advancement of Science and Art charge students now while pursuing a potential return to its tuition-free tradition.
abstract: New York State Supreme Court Justice Nancy M Bannon approves settlement that allows Cooper Union for the Advancement of Science and Art to charge its students tuition for short period of time while it figures out how to return to its tuition-free model.
lead_paragraph: A state judge approved a settlement on Wednesday that lets Cooper Union for the Advancement of Science and Art charge students now while pursuing a potential return to its tuition-free tradition.

headline.main: Judge Lets Cooper Union Levy Tuition in Short Term
headline.print_headline: Judge Lets Cooper Union Levy Tuition in Short Term

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Cooper Union for the Advancement of Science and Art
